arts.ttl: Reading boss on 'frustrating' Lincoln City defeat, Abrefa injury and play-off race
arts.sum: Reading dropped out of the play-offs on Good Friday following a 1-0 defeat to Lincoln City at the SCL Stadium.

arts.ttl: Reading drop out of League One play-off places with lacklustre Lincoln City loss
arts.sum: Reading dropped out of the League One play-off spots with a lacklustre 1-0 defeat to Lincoln City at the Select Car Leasing Stadium. George Wickens had next to nothing to do in the net for Michael Skubala's net despite a season high crowd of over 16,000 turning out to support Noel Hunt's side. James Collins found the game's only goal midway through the second half, heading past Joel Pereira with his first touch. Hunt made two changes from Saturday's 0-0 draw at Northampton Town, Kelvin Abrefa and Mamadi Camara coming in for Tivonge Rushesha and Jayden Wareham.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Two changes for Good Friday visit of Lincoln City
arts.sum: Reading manager Noel Hunt has made two changes for the Good Friday visit of Lincoln City, the penultimate home match of the campaign. The Royals sit sixth with four matches remaining, three points clear of seventh with an inferior goal difference. The Imps sit 12th and have little but pride to play for, while the Royals have it all to play for. For the visit of Michael Skubala's side, Hunt has opted to make just the two changes from Saturday's 0-0 draw at Northampton Town.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading kick off Easter double-header with Lincoln City visit
arts.sum: Reading host mid-table Lincoln City in the first of two Easter weekend matches, looking to keep up pace with the play-off sides. A season-high crowd is expected for the visit of the Imps.

arts.ttl: Reading legend on Wembley memories, Arsenal star and Steve Clarke cones
arts.sum: This morning, April 18 2025, Reading players, staff and supporters are waking up to a crunch clash in League One, sitting sixth and charging down the play-offs. However, 10 years ago the buzz was altogether different as over 30,000 supporters were preparing for a day 127 years in the making. It was way back in 1927 that a Reading team had last reached the last four of the prestigious FA Cup, the competition founded the same year as Reading Football Club. A defeat to eventual winners Cardiff City at Molineux made the papers and there would be many close attempts in the years to follow, reaching quarter-finals in 2010 and 2011 under Brian McDermott.

arts.ttl: Play-offs and promotion all Reading star 'cares about' ahead of Premier League move
arts.sum: Reading defender Tyler Bindon has admitted that he is not thinking about his summer move to Premier League Nottingham Forest yet, insisting all his focus is on promotion from League One. The 20-year-old New Zealand international has enjoyed a meteoric rise with the club since arriving from Los Angeles in 2023. Approaching 100 appearances for the club and a regular for his country, Nottingham Forest signed the central defender in February before loaning him back to Berkshire for the remainder of the season.

arts.ttl: Reading boss calls on 'unique' fanbase to continue backing the boys in their numbers
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt believes the club has a 'unique' fanbase due to it's family nature, but has called on supporters to continue turning out to push the boys onto a play-off finish. Hunt, who took over from Ruben Selles in December, has the Royals sat sixth with four matches remaining, including a double-header over Easter which begins at home to Lincoln City on Good Friday. While the supporters have been among the highest in the division, in spite of apathy against owner Dai Yongge, crowds have picked up in recent weeks ahead of what looks to be a memorable end of the campaign.h.

arts.ttl: Lincoln City boss aiming to 'spoil the party' at play-off chasing Reading
arts.sum: Lincoln City boss Michael Skubala is hoping to 'spoil the party' at Reading on Good Friday as the Royals target a play-off finish. The Imps are sat 12th in League One and have little but pride left to play for, but Reading hold sixth heading into the final four matches and are targeting a finish in the end of season play-offs. Lincoln won the reverse fixture at Sincil Bank in December, one of Noel Hunt's first matches in charge, but the Royals have been in fine form since the turn of the year. Skubala, with tonnes of respect for the club and its gaffer, wants to spoil the fun on Good Friday and begin preparations for next season in the third tier.

arts.ttl: ‘He is fine’ – Hull City man ‘ready’ to face Swansea City as Ruben Selles shares update
arts.sum: Hull City boss Ruben Selles has said John Egan is ‘fine’ to face Swansea City on Friday. Hull… The post ‘He is fine’ – Hull City man ‘ready’ to face Swansea City as Ruben Selles shares update appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: 'Nobody ever downs tools': Reading boss on 'organised and strong' Lincoln City threat
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt is wary of the threat posed by Lincoln City, even if the Imps have little left to play for. The Royals sit sixth in League One and have four matches remaining to confirm a play-off position, including a second match in quick succession at Mansfield Town on Easter Monday. Bristol Rovers are battling relegation, as were Northampton Town last week, while Barnsley battle Blackpool for a top 10 finish. Lincoln drew with soon-to-be-relegated Shrewsbury Town on Saturday and are 12th in the third tier, with little but pride and contracts to play for.
